page.title: 06HOUSING
page.content: In Libanus there are two types of building material used; stone and brick. The majority of the stone buildings are the older houses and farms. Many of the farmhouses were built by the farmers, when the land was first cultivated, using the local stone for walls and slate for the roof. The modern houses are built of brick or simulated stone and they have tiles for the roof. Today it is easier and cheaper for the builder to buy bricks, artificial stone and tiles to build with. Most of the farms have coal or log fires and some have central heating.The majority of modern houses are heated by central heating. The village houses and some farms have a piped water supply and mains drainage but some of the more remote farms have their water supplied from a spring and have septic tanks.
